ygData.msgSnippet: Dear Dr. Goodwin, when I try to compile cantera with gcc 3.4.x following error occurs at ctrpath.cpp: ************************ g++ -c ctrpath.cpp -I../../src

Dear Dr. Goodwin,

when I try to compile cantera with gcc 3.4.x following error occurs at
ctrpath.cpp:

************************
g++ -c ctrpath.cpp -I../../src   -O2 -g -Wall  -fPIC
ctrpath.cpp:1: warning: -fPIC ignored for target (all code is position
independe
nt)
ctrpath.cpp:25: error: too few template-parameter-lists
ctrpath.cpp:25: error: expected `,' or `;' before '=' token
ctrpath.cpp:26: error: too few template-parameter-lists
ctrpath.cpp:26: error: expected `,' or `;' before '=' token
make: *** [ctrpath.o] Error 1
************************

Looking at the mentioned lines I see:
Cabinet<ReactionPathDiagram>*  
Cabinet<ReactionPathDiagram>::__storage = 0;
Cabinet<builder_t>*             Cabinet<builder_t>::__storage = 0;

I think gcc 3.4.x handles template initialization more strictly than
gcc 3.3.x and VC7++. Is there a workaround to get it to run ?

best regards
Ulf
